text: - Hi, my name is Vaibhav Khandelwal.
I'm a Senior Product Manager

in the AWS database
migration services team.
Today I would like to talk about
how AWS DMS team can help our customers
migrate their database workloads into AWS?
When we talk to customers about migrating
their database workloads, they have
certain business objectives.
So those business objectives are
their hardware is due for refresh,

or their data centered lease
is coming up for renewal.

The second business objectives
some customers have,
is their software license.
Specifically the database vendor license
is coming up for renewal,
and they would like to move to AWS

because they don't want
to renew this expensive
commercial database vendor license.
At AWS DMS team,

we have a tool called AWS
Schema Conversion Tool,
also known as SCT.

SCT is a tool that's available
free of cost to our customers
that can be downloaded from AWS website.

Once downloaded, customers
can install it on their laptop
or any host that they have available.

Once installed, SCT can
connect to their databases.
These databases can vary from

OLTP databases such as
Oracle, or SQL Server

and it could be any
database warehouse workloads

such as Greenplum,
Netezza, Teradata, Vertica,

and it can scan the code,
basically the schema

different functions,
stored procedures, views,
and different database objects.
Once it scans all that information,
it can generate a report
that gives customers an unbiased view
into what are their different options,
when it comes to moving their database,
and analytics workloads over to AWS.
The report is very easy to follow
where it shows the related complexity

of each target service, where
they want to move to AWS.
So customers who have an objective,
or rather business objective of

moving to AWS quickly
because they don't want
to refresh their hardware
and they don't want to change
their underlying database engine,
they can move to a managed service
such as RDS, Oracle, or RDS SQL Server.
And also customers who don't want
to renew their database licenses
and they're looking at moving into

a open source target
database service in AWS,

they can easily move to
Aurora Postgres, Aurora MySQL.
AWS SCT helps them convert their schema
to the choice of their target database,
in AWS where they intend to move.

For the things that it
cannot convert automatically,
AWS provides them an executive summary
of the action items,

or the action these
customers need to take,

where it shows what are
the recommended actions,
if something that cannot be converted
automatically with SCT.

So customers can actually
build a very successful
and predictable migration plan
that gives them an idea,
how much time would it take to migrate
their database workloads over to AWS.

With AWS SCT, customers can
convert their database schema
ETL scripts, and application code,
and eventually build a successful
and predictable migration plan.

Check out SCT on AWS website
where you can read about it
and understand how customers can use it,

to accelerate their database
migration journey into AWS.
Thank you.
